attributes.action: have a Referendum on who can vote in any UK election in any part of the UK
attributes.additional_details: voters will deicide at the ballot box
attributes.background: The Question should be should only over 18s and UK citizens or common wealth citizens be allowed to vote in any election in any part of the UK

rejection.details:
We can only accept petitions about things the Government or Parliament are directly responsible for.

The UK Government is responsible for setting the franchise for UK parliamentary elections and local elections in England and Northern Ireland, but decisions about the franchise for parliamentary and local elections in Scotland and Wales are a matter for the Scottish and Welsh Parliament, not the UK Government or Parliament.

We could accept a petition calling on the Government to hold a referendum on changing the franchise for elections for which it sets the franchise.
